page.title: 17THE CHURCH IN BILLINGTON
page.content: The Anglican church is run by the annually elected Parish Church Council and two church wardens who have contact with the vicar at Leighton Buzzard, Reverend Peter Whittaker. They are also responsible for the church fabric and finance including insurance, and fund raising. Money is sent to the St Albans diocese towards administration costs, salaries and training of clergy. The church is the centre of the village, and although few people attend services, the villagers do not want it to close. To try and become more involved in the village life a questionaire has been sent to all households to see how this can be achieved. Two chapels that were in Billington have now closed thus it is felt to be the duty of the parishioners to keep the church alive for future generations.
